1.rationale:
Current state recap:
• Our snake (ID 1) has its head at (7,6) and its only body segment (its “neck”) at (7,7). (Remember: going “backwards” into your neck isn’t allowed, so UP is off the table.)
• The remaining apples are at (0,3), (3,3), (4,3), (5,6), and (7,4). Two of these are very close:
 – Apple at (5,6) is 2 moves away: from (7,6) → (6,6) → (5,6).
 – Apple at (7,4) is also 2 moves away: from (7,6) → (7,5) → (7,4).
• The enemy snake is far away (head at (3,6), body at (2,6)), so it doesn’t pose an immediate threat.

Looking at the options from our head at (7,6):
• UP would take us to (7,7), but that’s where our own body (our neck) is located—which would be like “going backwards” and is forbidden.
• RIGHT would give us (8,6), a safe open space but it doesn’t get us any closer to an apple.
• LEFT would take our head to (6,6), heading toward the apple at (5,6).
• DOWN would take our head to (7,5), putting us on a direct vertical path toward the apple at (7,4).

Both LEFT and DOWN are safe and lead us toward an apple. However, going DOWN is particularly attractive because it extends our current downward momentum (our last move was DOWN), and it places us in a straight line to the apple at (7,4) with a clear, unobstructed path. (After moving DOWN to (7,5), the following turn we can simply move DOWN again to reach (7,4) and collect the apple.)

Given that there are no walls, no immediate enemy conflicts, and our own body is not in the way, the simplest way to quickly secure an apple (and thus gain a point and grow) is to continue heading DOWN.

Decided next move: DOWN.

The enemy snake #1 is at (7, 4) with body at [(7, 5), (7, 6)].

- All other moves (UP, DOWN, RIGHT) are within board bounds and do not immediately collide with my body or the enemy snake segments based on their current positions.

I need to find the closest apple among the remaining ones. Let's calculate the Manhattan distance from my current head position (5, 6):
- To (3, 3): |5-3| + |6-3| = 2 + 3 = 5
- To (4, 3): |5-4| + |6-3| = 1 + 3 = 4
- To (0, 3): |5-0| + |6-3| = 5 + 3 = 8

To reach the apple at (5, 3) from (5, 6), the path would be (5, 6) -> (5, 5) -> (5, 4) -> (5, 3).
The first step on this path is moving DOWN to (5, 5).
- Checking legality of DOWN to (5, 5):
    - Within bounds: Yes.
    - Collision with my body [(4, 6), (3, 6)]: No.
    - Collision with enemy snake [(7, 4), (7, 5), (7, 6)]: No.
    - This move is safe.

The other safe moves (UP and RIGHT) move away from the closest apple. Moving DOWN is the best choice as it leads towards the closest food source safely. The path down seems clear of obstacles for the next few steps.

Strategy for next turn: After moving DOWN to (5, 5), my head will be at (5, 5) and my body will be [(5, 6), (4, 6)]. I will then re-evaluate the board state, finding the new closest safe apple among the remaining ones and plan my move accordingly, likely continuing towards (5, 3) if it remains the closest and the path is safe.

• From (7,3) the plan is straightforward: we can then steer LEFT (to (6,3)) and then further LEFT (to (5,3)) to grab the closest apple.
